This function parses a [[/JSON.md|JSON]] formatted string into variables. You can use [[/toJSON.md|toJSON]] to encode variables into a JSON string that can be read by this function.

==Syntax== 
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
var fromJSON ( string json )
</syntaxhighlight> 

===Required Arguments=== 
*'''json:''' A JSON formatted string

===Returns===
Returns variables read from the JSON string.

'''Note:''' Indices of a JSON object such as "1": "cat" are being returned as [[/string.md|string]], not as [[/int.md|int]]eger.

==Example== 
This makes data equal: ''{ ["1"] = "cat", ["2"] = "mouse", ["3"] = 5, ["4"] = null, ["cat"] = 5, ["mouse"] =1 }''
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
local data = fromJSON ( '[ { "1": "cat", "2": "mouse", "3": 5, "4": null, "cat":5, "mouse":1 } ]' )
</syntaxhighlight>

==Example 2==
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
local name, weapon, ammo = fromJSON("[\"Desert Eagle\", 24, 147]")
</syntaxhighlight>
